alert.note: Alert for Eastern Ulster; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Ulster County through 330 PM EDT... At 300 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Kerhonkson, or 8 miles northeast of Ellenville, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... New Paltz, Ellenville, High Falls, Kerhonkson, Tillson, Napanoch, Olivebridge, Wawarsing, Rosendale, Marbletown, Maple Hill, Atwood, Dwaarkill, Pacama, Liebhardt, Fantinekill, Awosting, Stone Ridge, Mombaccus and Honk Hill. This includes Interstate 87 near exit 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
